intro: Humiria obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate fern, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Humiria obovata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and swampy areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
